repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: UNITE, the Union of Needle Trades, Industrial, and Textile Employees was formed in 1995 after a merger between the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union (ILGWU) and the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union (ACTWU).
In 2004 they announced they would merge with the Hotel Employees and Restaurant Employees Union (HERE) which created UNITE HERE.
Jay Mazur served as president of UNITE from its beginning until his retirement in 2001. Bruce Raynor was elected president at that time and served until the HERE merger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of over 1,500 photographs documenting UNITE's Northeast Dept.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: UNITE Northeast Department Photographs #6000/012 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: 2 photographs ; oversize, rolled and wrinkled. Photos could be put into a photo preservation project
